lyrics.stanza: The story of the gospel Is that the Lord loved us. The story of Mary Is that she loved the Lord.
The Lord loving us And we loving Him; This the fragrance of Our love offering.
We must preach both: The Lord Jesus loving us. And we like Mary, Loving Him to the uttermost.
One is salvation, The other consecration. Lord, we pour out All our love offering.
As we pour upon Him, This is not just a waste But a fragrant testimony Of the sweetness of the Lord.
The Lord loving us And we loving Him: This the fragrance Of our love offering.
Throughout the past centuries, Tens of thousands of precious lives, Heart treasures, golden futures Have been wasted upon the Lord.
To such lovers, He's altogether lovely And ultimately worthy Of their costly ointment.
We must love the Lord, And grasp the opportunity. Yes, love Him to the uttermost: A fragrance sweet to God and man.
The Lord loving us And we loving Him: This the fragrance Of our love offering.
Lord Jesus, we just love You. Our life and all we pour on You. We waste ourselves upon You. In this universe we just love You.
We can't help but love You, You're the greatest value. Our love is just an issue Of our seeing of You.
